result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany S Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and child care.

miscConds.notes:
Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, during term of probation. Failure to pay results in a civil judgement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittany S Harris

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Brittany S Harris in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1: Defendant ordered to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, credit of 3 days time served, Huber privileges for work and child care. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Anger management course
- 20 hours of community service
- No contact with JT 
- No further violations of the law.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, during term of probation.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

Court ordered defendant to report to probation intake and DNA swab by endof day 05-05-2022

Defendant Brittany S Harris in court with attorney Michael Fuentes on behalf of Jason A Findling.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brittany S Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Calendar Call held.  Court orders previously stayed warrant vacated.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Brittany S Harris in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brittany S Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and offer and requests plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, filed.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed.  Report forwarded to Judge for review.

Court ordered no contact with J.M.T.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Brittany S Harris in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Brittany S Harris in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brittany S Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
